div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 21:52 pm CDT

div.div: Scattered showers and thunderstorms, mainly between midnight and 1am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 43. East southeast wind 7 to 9 mph becoming southwest after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 30%.
Sunny, with a high near 71. West wind 8 to 11 mph becoming north in the afternoon.
Mostly clear, with a low around 42. North wind 5 to 7 mph becoming light and variable after midnight.

div.p: USD 227 will provide a caring, safe learning environment that gives all students the opportunity to achieve their highest potential.

a.aria-label: Read more about USD 227 MISSION STATEMENT

h3.a: Notice of Breakfast and Lunch Protocol

div.p: Students, Parents & Patrons of USD #227:

Beginning Monday, March 30th, our district will be providing grab and go breakfasts and lunches through the end of the school term (May 13 or until we are notified by KSDE child Nutrition that the program will cease).
We WILL NOT be serving meals on April 10, April 13 or April 20.

All meals are free to any child ages 1-18 regardless of income status or residency status. Children must be present in the car to receive meals. We will not provide meals to adults requesting more than the amount of children with them.
The protocol will be as follows:
In Jetmore - curbside pick up at the elementary school. Children must be present in the vehicle to verify number of meals to be provided. Walk-ups are also welcome.
West of town you can pick up at Ron Wilson's. Children must be present in the vehicle to verify number of meals to be provided.
North of town you can pick up at the school house on V Rd. Children must be present in the vehicle to verify number of meals to be provided.
East of town you can pick up at Elk Plaza in Hanston Children must be present in the vehicle to verify number of meals to be provided. Walk-ups are also welcome.
South of town you can pick up at D Rd. Children must be present in the vehicle to verify number of meals to be provided.
Serving Days - Monday and Wednesday Mar. 30th-April 9th & April 27th-May13th ; Tuesday and Thursday April 13th-24th (Due to Easter).
Serving time will be from 10 a.m - 11 a.m. in all locations.
You will be provided breakfast and lunch for two days on Monday and three days on Wednesday.

You will need to text or email Christina Cohoon @ 620-878-3444 or cohoon90@gmail.com and let her know your name and how many children need meals. Please contact her no later than Fridays @ noon to be counted for meals the following week.
These meals are provided specifically to help you during this time. This is something new to us so please be patient as we work out the kinks the first few days.
Thank you,
Doug Chaney

a.aria-label: Read more about Notice of Breakfast and Lunch Protocol

h3.a: UPDATE FROM USD 227 REGARDING THE CORONAVIRUS

div.p: Parents:
I just wanted to give you a quick update. We are currently working on what educating our students will look like.

We are needing to gather a little information from you in order for us to move forward and any information you provide will be kept confidential. The survey link is below and we would appreciate 100% participation. It will also be on the school website and on our school Facebook page. Please only fill it out one time.
We know your students have belongings in the buildings still and we are working on a solution to get those back to you. Please be patient with us as we get this all sorted out.
Doug Chaney
Superintendent
USD 227 Hodgeman County

a.aria-label: Read more about UPDATE FROM USD 227 REGARDING THE CORONAVIRUS

span.span: The Hodgeman County Grade School Reading program

We have compiled our tastiest, tried-and-true recipes into a single book that will be treasured for generations to come. It contains almost 400 recipes from our students, their families and friends. 100% of the proceeds from this cookbook effort will be used to support the reading program at the Grade School, for the purchase of books for classroom libraries and for reading incentives for our students at Hodgeman County Grade School.
The cookbooks have arrived and are available for purchase just in time for gift-giving and Christmas.
Cookbooks can be purchased from the Grade School Office (620-357-8395), at The Farmer's State Bank,
Jetmore Food Center, Jetmore City Office, & The Hodgeman County Health Center.
The cookbooks are priced at $15 per copy.
Please make checks payable to USD #227.
We hope you enjoy trying all kinds of new recipes. Thank you for supporting our young readers!
